note_text:
Pre-op: Recurrent malignant effusion, now minimal output. Spontaneous pleurodesis.
Procedure: Right PleurX removal (32552).
- Local lidocaine.
- Incision at exit site.
- Cuff dissected from subq tissue.
- Catheter removed intact.
- 3-0 Nylon closure.
Complications: None.
Plan: Wound care.

clinical_context.primary_indication: IPC removal due to spontaneous pleurodesis

code_rationales.32552: Removal of indwelling tunneled pleural catheter (PleurX) with cuff.
Removal of indwelling tunneled pleural catheter with cuff.

note_text:
HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: Ms. Chen, a 73-year-old female with metastatic ovarian carcinoma, presented for elective removal of a right-sided indwelling pleural catheter. The device was placed four months prior for palliation of malignant pleural effusion. Recent logs indicate drainage has ceased, suggesting successful autopleurodesis.
OPERATIVE NARRATIVE: The patient was placed in the left lateral decubitus position. Following sterile preparation and infiltration of 1% lidocaine, an incision was made along the catheter track. The Dacron cuff was identified and liberated via blunt dissection from the subcutaneous tissue. The catheter was extracted without resistance. Inspection confirmed the device was intact. The tract was closed with simple interrupted sutures.
IMPRESSION: Successful removal of right IPC.

clinical_context.primary_indication: IPC removal due to spontaneous pleurodesis

code_rationales.32552: Removal of indwelling tunneled pleural catheter (PleurX) with cuff.
Removal of indwelling tunneled pleural catheter with cuff.

note_text:
Service: Removal of tunneled pleural catheter (CPT 32552).
Indication: Cessation of flow consistent with pleurodesis.
Technique:
1. Anesthesia: Local infiltration (1% lidocaine).
2. Exposure: Incision performed to expose the subcutaneous cuff (approx. 2cm from exit).
3. Removal: Cuff dissected free from fibrous capsule. Catheter withdrawn from pleural space.
4. Closure: Sutures applied.
Findings: Catheter removed intact (28cm). No signs of tract infection.

clinical_context.primary_indication: IPC removal due to spontaneous pleurodesis

code_rationales.32552: Removal of indwelling tunneled pleural catheter (PleurX) with cuff.
Removal of indwelling tunneled pleural catheter with cuff.

note_text:
Procedure: IPC Removal
Attending: Dr. Morrison
Resident: [Name]
Steps:
1. Time out performed. Right chest prepped.
2. Local anesthetic injected.
3. Cut down on cuff.
4. Dissected cuff free using hemostats.
5. Pulled catheter out. No resistance.
6. Stitched up with 3-0 nylon.
Plan: Keep dry for 48h. Suture removal in 10-14 days.

clinical_context.primary_indication: IPC removal due to spontaneous pleurodesis

code_rationales.32552: Removal of indwelling tunneled pleural catheter (PleurX) with cuff.
Removal of indwelling tunneled pleural catheter with cuff.

note_text: pt margaret chen here for pleurx removal right side drainage stopped so we assume pleurodesis used local numbing cut down to the cuff freed it up with the kelly clamp and pulled it out came out fine no issues stitched it up with nylon patient tolerated well discharge home thanks.

clinical_context.primary_indication: IPC removal due to spontaneous pleurodesis

code_rationales.32552: Removal of indwelling tunneled pleural catheter (PleurX) with cuff.
Removal of indwelling tunneled pleural catheter with cuff.

note_text: Margaret Chen 73F presented for removal of right PleurX catheter due to decreased drainage. Under local anesthesia the right lateral chest wall was prepped. The catheter exit site was identified and anesthetized. An incision was made to expose the retention cuff. The cuff was dissected free from the subcutaneous tissues. The catheter was removed intact. The wound was closed with sutures and a sterile dressing applied. The patient tolerated the procedure well.

clinical_context.primary_indication: IPC removal due to spontaneous pleurodesis

note_text:
[Indication]
Metastatic ovarian cancer, s/p Right PleurX, now with autopleurodesis (minimal output).
[Anesthesia]
Local 1% lidocaine.
[Description]
Incision made at exit site. Cuff identified and dissected free from adhesions. Catheter withdrawn from right hemithorax intact. Hemostasis achieved. Wound closed with 3-0 nylon.
[Plan]
Discharge home. Wound care instructions given. Follow up 2 weeks.

clinical_context.primary_indication: IPC removal due to spontaneous pleurodesis

code_rationales.32552: Removal of indwelling tunneled pleural catheter (PleurX) with cuff.
Removal of indwelling tunneled pleural catheter with cuff.

note_text: The patient is a 73-year-old female with a history of ovarian cancer who came in to have her right lung catheter removed. She has had the catheter for about 4 months, but lately, hardly any fluid has been coming out, which means the lung has likely adhered to the chest wall. We numbed the area with lidocaine and made a small cut to reach the cuff that holds the tube in place. Once we freed the cuff, the tube slid out easily. We stitched up the small cut and put a bandage on it.

clinical_context.primary_indication: IPC removal due to spontaneous pleurodesis

note_text:
Operation: Extraction of tunneled pleural drain.
Reason: Accomplished symphysis.
Method: Under local blockade, the tissue surrounding the anchor cuff was separated. The conduit was withdrawn from the pleural cavity without incident. The entry site was approximated with sutures.

note_text:
Indication: Large Left pleural effusion, decompensated CHF.
Procedure: Therapeutic Thoracentesis (32554).
- Sitting position.
- Local: Lido 1%.
- Needle insertion: 8th ICS, posterior axillary line.
- Fluid: 1800mL straw-colored removed.
- No imaging used (Landmark technique).
Complications: None.
Status: Dyspnea improved.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Large left pleural effusion causing respiratory distress in decompensated CHF

code_rationales.32554: Thoracentesis performed without imaging guidance using physical exam landmarks.

note_text:
PROCEDURE: Therapeutic Thoracentesis (without imaging guidance).
CLINICAL SUMMARY: Mr. Kim, a 70-year-old male with NYHA Class IV heart failure, presented with acute respiratory distress secondary to a massive left-sided pleural effusion.
TECHNIQUE: The patient was positioned upright. The left hemithorax was percussed to delineate the fluid level. The 8th intercostal space was selected based on physical landmarks. Following aseptic preparation and local anesthesia, an 18G catheter-over-needle was introduced into the pleural space. A total of 1.8 liters of serous fluid was evacuated via gravity drainage. The catheter was withdrawn, and the patient reported immediate symptomatic relief.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Large left pleural effusion causing respiratory distress in decompensated CHF

code_rationales.32554: Thoracentesis performed without imaging guidance using physical exam landmarks.

note_text:
CPT Code: 32554 (Thoracentesis without imaging).
Site: Left Hemithorax.
Volume: 1800 mL.
Technique: Percussion used to identify fluid level. Needle entry at 8th intercostal space. Imaging was NOT utilized for this procedure.
Medical Necessity: Therapeutic relief of respiratory distress due to large effusion.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Large left pleural effusion causing respiratory distress in decompensated CHF

code_rationales.32554: Thoracentesis performed without imaging guidance using physical exam landmarks.

Staff: Dr. Johnson

1. Prepped left back.
2. Numbed with lido.
3. Inserted needle 8th rib space.
4. Drained 1800cc yellow fluid.
5. Pulled needle.
Patient feels much better. Sats up to 95%.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Large left pleural effusion causing respiratory distress in decompensated CHF

code_rationales.32554: Thoracentesis performed without imaging guidance using physical exam landmarks.

The patient tolerated the procedure well with improvement in oxygen saturation.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Large left pleural effusion causing respiratory distress in decompensated CHF

code_rationales.32554: Thoracentesis performed without imaging guidance using physical exam landmarks.

note_text: Mr. Kim was struggling to breathe due to fluid around his left lung from his heart failure. We performed a procedure to drain this fluid at the bedside. We sat him up and tapped on his back to find the best spot. We didn't need to use ultrasound. We numbed the skin and put a small tube in, draining about 1.8 liters of clear yellow fluid. He felt much better right away and his oxygen levels went up.

Site: Left thoracic cavity.

Outcome: Alleviation of dyspnea.

note_text:
Dx: Recurrent malignant R effusion.
Action: Chemical Pleurodesis (32560).
- Chest tube confirmed functional.
- 4g Talc slurry instilled.
- Dwell time: 1 hr with rotation.
- Tube to suction.
Outcome: Tolerated well w/ morphine.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Recurrent symptomatic malignant pleural effusion - pleurodesis for palliation

code_rationales.32560: Instillation of talc slurry via chest tube for pleurodesis.
Instillation of talc slurry (4g) via existing chest tube for chemical pleurodesis.

note_text:
OPERATIVE REPORT: Instillation of Sclerosing Agent.
INDICATION: Ms. Adams, a 76-year-old female with metastatic breast carcinoma, required palliation for a recurrent right malignant pleural effusion.
PROCEDURE: The existing right-sided 14Fr chest tube was utilized. A slurry comprising 4 grams of sterile talc suspended in 50mL of normal saline was prepared. This suspension was instilled into the pleural cavity. The tubing was clamped for sixty minutes, during which the patient was rotated to facilitate widespread pleural contact. Subsequently, the tube was unclamped and placed on -20cmH2O suction to appose the pleural surfaces.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Recurrent symptomatic malignant pleural effusion - pleurodesis for palliation

code_rationales.32560: Instillation of talc slurry via chest tube for pleurodesis.
Instillation of talc slurry (4g) via existing chest tube for chemical pleurodesis.

Method: Slurry via existing chest tube.
Location: Right pleural space.
Requirements met: Instillation of sclerosing agent for therapeutic pleurodesis of malignant effusion.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Recurrent symptomatic malignant pleural effusion - pleurodesis for palliation

Patient: Dorothy Adams
Steps:
1. Checked chest tube output (<100ml).
2. Mixed 4g talc in saline.
3. Pushed slurry into tube.
4. Clamped tube.
5. Rotated patient q15 mins.
6. Unclamped after 1 hour.
Pain managed with morphine.

Indication was recurrent right malignant pleural effusion. 4 grams of talc were mixed in 50mL saline and instilled through the existing chest tube. code_rationales.32560: Instillation of talc slurry via chest tube for pleurodesis.
Instillation of talc slurry (4g) via existing chest tube for chemical pleurodesis.

note_text: Mrs. Adams has fluid coming back around her right lung because of her cancer. We decided to 'glue' the lung to the chest wall to stop the fluid. We used her existing chest tube to put a mixture of talc and water inside. We clamped the tube and had her roll around in bed for an hour to coat the inside of her chest. Afterward, we put the tube back on suction. She had some pain but we treated it with medication.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Recurrent symptomatic malignant pleural effusion - pleurodesis for palliation

Context: Recurrent right thoracic effusion.
Action: Talc suspension (4g) was infused via the indwelling thoracostomy tube. Following a dwell period with repositioning, negative pressure was re-applied to promote symphysis.

note_text:
Indication: Bilateral nodules (RUL, LUL).
Procedure: Bronchoscopy w/ TBLB (Bi-lobar).
- 31628: TBLB RUL x6.
- 31632: TBLB LUL x5.
- 31627: Nav used.
- 31624: BAL RUL.
Results: Samples obtained. No pneumothorax.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Bilateral PET-avid lung nodules requiring tissue diagnosis

code_rationales.31628: Transbronchial lung biopsy of first lobe (RUL).
code_rationales.+31632: Transbronchial lung biopsy of additional lobe (LUL).

note_text:
PROCEDURE NOTE: Flexible Bronchoscopy with Transbronchial Biopsy of Multiple Lobes.
INDICATION: Evaluation of PET-avid nodules in the RUL (1.8cm) and LUL (1.2cm).
NARRATIVE: The bronchoscope was introduced. The Ion navigation system was utilized to localize the target in the Right Upper Lobe. Transbronchial biopsies were obtained (CPT 31628). Subsequently, the scope was navigated to the Left Upper Lobe nodule. A separate set of biopsies was obtained from this second lobe (CPT 31632). A BAL was also performed in the RUL. There were no complications.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Bilateral PET-avid lung nodules requiring tissue diagnosis

code_rationales.31628: Transbronchial lung biopsy of first lobe (RUL).
code_rationales.+31632: Transbronchial lung biopsy of additional lobe (LUL).

note_text:
Billing Summary:
- 31628: TBLB, Initial Lobe (RUL).
- 31632: TBLB, Additional Lobe (LUL).
- 31627: Navigation guidance.
- 31624: Bronchoalveolar Lavage.
Justification: Biopsies taken from two distinct lobes (Right Upper and Left Upper) requiring repositioning and separate sampling passes.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Bilateral PET-avid lung nodules requiring tissue diagnosis

code_rationales.31628: Transbronchial lung biopsy of first lobe (RUL).
code_rationales.+31632: Transbronchial lung biopsy of additional lobe (LUL).

4. BAL done in RUL.
5. Fluoro used.
No pneumo on post-op film.

note_text: Mr. Wilson has spots on both his right and left lungs that we needed to sample. We put him to sleep and used a special navigation scope. First, we went to the top right part of the lung and took several small pieces of tissue. Then, we moved the scope to the top left part of the lung and took more samples from there. We also washed the right lung to check for infection. Everything went smoothly.

note_text:
Indication: Staging RUL CA.
Procedure:
- 31653: EBUS 3 stations (4R, 7, 4L).
- 31629: TBNA RUL mass (First lobe).
- 31633: TBNA LUL nodule (Add'l lobe).
Results: N2 disease confirmed.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Staging of RUL adenocarcinoma with mediastinal lymphadenopathy

code_rationales.31629: Conventional TBNA of RUL parenchymal mass - first lobe.

note_text:
OPERATIVE REPORT: EBUS-TBNA and Conventional TBNA.
The mediastinum was staged utilizing EBUS, sampling stations 4R, 7, and 4L. Attention was then turned to parenchymal targets. Using a conventional TBNA needle, the RUL mass was sampled (Initial Lobe, 31629). Subsequently, the separate LUL nodule was identified and sampled (Additional Lobe, 31633). ROSE confirmed malignancy.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Staging of RUL adenocarcinoma with mediastinal lymphadenopathy

code_rationales.31629: Conventional TBNA of RUL parenchymal mass - first lobe.

note_text:

- 31653 (EBUS-TBNA 3+ stations).
- 31629 (Transtracheal/bronchial needle aspiration, initial lobe/structure - RUL Mass).
- 31633 (TBNA, each additional lobe - LUL Nodule).
Rationale: Separate parenchymal lesions in distinct lobes sampled via needle aspiration.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Staging of RUL adenocarcinoma with mediastinal lymphadenopathy

code_rationales.31629: Conventional TBNA of RUL parenchymal mass - first lobe.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Staging of RUL adenocarcinoma with mediastinal lymphadenopathy

We also saw a spot on her left lung and used the needle to sample that one as well to see if the cancer had spread there.

note_text:

clinical_context.primary_indication: Severe heterogeneous emphysema - BLVR candidate with CV-negative LUL

code_rationales.+31651 (x3): Three additional valves placed in LB3, LB4, and LB5.

note_text:
PROCEDURE: Bronchoscopic Lung Volume Reduction.
TARGET: Left Upper Lobe.
DETAILS: The airway was sized. The first valve (Zephyr 5.5) was deployed in the apicoposterior segment (Initial Lobe, 31647). Subsequently, valves were deployed in the Anterior, Superior Lingula, and Inferior Lingula segments (Each additional bronchus, 31651 x3). Complete lobar occlusion was verified visually.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Severe heterogeneous emphysema - BLVR candidate with CV-negative LUL

code_rationales.+31651 (x3): Three additional valves placed in LB3, LB4, and LB5.

- 31651 (3 units): Additional bronchus valve placements (LB3, LB4, LB5).
Note: Procedure performed in LUL. Four distinct segmental bronchi treated.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Severe heterogeneous emphysema - BLVR candidate with CV-negative LUL

code_rationales.+31651 (x3): Three additional valves placed in LB3, LB4, and LB5.

4. Placed valve in LB4 (Add-on).
5. Placed valve in LB5 (Add-on).
All valves look good.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Severe heterogeneous emphysema - BLVR candidate with CV-negative LUL

code_rationales.+31651 (x3): Three additional valves placed in LB3, LB4, and LB5.

note_text: We treated Mr. Johnson's emphysema by blocking off the diseased upper left part of his lung. We placed a total of four one-way valves. The first one went into the top segment, and then we placed three more in the remaining segments of that lobe to make sure no air could get in. This should help the healthier parts of his lung work better.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Severe heterogeneous emphysema - BLVR candidate with CV-negative LUL

code_rationales.+31651 (x3): Three additional valves placed in LB3, LB4, and LB5.

note_text:
Procedure: Deployment of bronchial flow-control devices.
Target: LUL.
Action: Primary device anchored in LB1+2. Supplemental devices anchored in LB3, LB4, and LB5.
Outcome: Lobar isolation.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Severe heterogeneous emphysema - BLVR candidate with CV-negative LUL

code_rationales.+31651 (x3): Three additional valves placed in LB3, LB4, and LB5.

note_text:
Indication: Loculated R effusion.
Procedure: US-guided pigtail placement (32557).
- US loc: 7th ICS.
- Seldinger technique.
- 14Fr catheter placed.
- 850mL turbid fluid drained.
Complications: None.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Complex parapneumonic effusion requiring image-guided drainage

code_rationales.32557: Pleural drainage with percutaneous insertion of indwelling catheter under ultrasound guidance.

note_text:
PROCEDURE NOTE: Percutaneous Pleural Drainage with Imaging Guidance.
INDICATION: Complex parapneumonic effusion, Right.
DESCRIPTION: Under real-time ultrasound guidance, the effusion was localized. A needle was advanced into the fluid pocket. A guidewire was passed, the tract dilated, and a 14Fr indwelling catheter was inserted. 850mL of purulent fluid was evacuated. Placement was confirmed via ultrasound.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Complex parapneumonic effusion requiring image-guided drainage

code_rationales.32557: Pleural drainage with percutaneous insertion of indwelling catheter under ultrasound guidance.

note_text:
Code: 32557.
Description: Pleural drainage with insertion of indwelling catheter, with imaging guidance.
Method: Ultrasound used for access and placement confirmation.
Device: 14Fr Pigtail.
Output: 850mL.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Complex parapneumonic effusion requiring image-guided drainage

code_rationales.32557: Pleural drainage with percutaneous insertion of indwelling catheter under ultrasound guidance.

note_text:
Procedure: Chest Tube with US
Steps:
1. US to find spot (Right 7th intercostal).
2. Numbed skin.
3. Needle -> Wire -> Dilator -> Tube.
4. Hooked up to pleur-evac.
5. Drained pus.
Catheter stays in.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Complex parapneumonic effusion requiring image-guided drainage

code_rationales.32557: Pleural drainage with percutaneous insertion of indwelling catheter under ultrasound guidance.

note_text: patricia moore needs a drain for right side empyema. brought ultrasound in saw the pocket. put a pigtail in using the wire technique. got a lot of junk out like 850ml. stitched it in place. us shows it looks good.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Complex parapneumonic effusion requiring image-guided drainage

code_rationales.32557: Pleural drainage with percutaneous insertion of indwelling catheter under ultrasound guidance.

note_text: Ultrasound-guided pleural drainage performed on right hemithorax. 14Fr pigtail catheter inserted using Seldinger technique under continuous imaging. 850mL turbid fluid removed. Catheter secured.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Complex parapneumonic effusion requiring image-guided drainage

code_rationales.32557: Pleural drainage with percutaneous insertion of indwelling catheter under ultrasound guidance.

note_text:
[Indication]
Complex R effusion.
[Anesthesia]
Local + Moderate Sedation.
[Description]
US guidance used. 14Fr catheter inserted into right pleural space. 850mL drained.
[Plan]
Connect to suction. Antibiotics.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Complex parapneumonic effusion requiring image-guided drainage

code_rationales.32557: Pleural drainage with percutaneous insertion of indwelling catheter under ultrasound guidance.

note_text: Ms. Moore had a pocket of infected fluid around her right lung that needed draining. Using an ultrasound machine to guide us, we placed a small tube through her back and into the fluid. We drained about 850mL of cloudy fluid and left the tube in place to keep draining it.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Complex parapneumonic effusion requiring image-guided drainage

code_rationales.32557: Pleural drainage with percutaneous insertion of indwelling catheter under ultrasound guidance.

note_text:
Procedure: Image-directed thoracostomy.
Action: Utilizing sonographic visualization, a drainage conduit was introduced into the right pleural cavity. Purulent collection was evacuated.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Complex parapneumonic effusion requiring image-guided drainage

code_rationales.32557: Pleural drainage with percutaneous insertion of indwelling catheter under ultrasound guidance.

note_text:
Indication: Migrated LMS stent.
Procedure: Rigid bronchoscopy with Stent Revision (31638).
- Stent found protruding into trachea.
- Granulation tissue debrided.
- Stent grasped and pushed distal into LMS.
- Position confirmed.
Patency restored.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Migrated LMS stent causing airway obstruction - stent revision

code_rationales.31638: Bronchoscopy with revision of tracheal/bronchial stent. Migrated SEMS repositioned from distal trachea back into left mainstem bronchus.

note_text:
OPERATIVE REPORT: Bronchoscopic Revision of Airway Prosthesis.
INDICATION: Dyspnea secondary to proximal migration of Left Mainstem Stent.
PROCEDURE: Rigid bronchoscopy revealed the Ultraflex stent extending into the distal trachea. Using rigid forceps, the prosthesis was mobilized. It was successfully repositioned distally into the left mainstem bronchus. Airway patency was fully restored, and the stent is now seated appropriately.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Migrated LMS stent causing airway obstruction - stent revision

code_rationales.31638: Bronchoscopy with revision of tracheal/bronchial stent. Migrated SEMS repositioned from distal trachea back into left mainstem bronchus.

note_text:
Code: 31638 (Revision of tracheal/bronchial stent).
Target: Left Mainstem Bronchus.
Action: Repositioning of migrated SEMS.
Note: Includes debridement of granulation tissue facilitating the revision.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Migrated LMS stent causing airway obstruction - stent revision

code_rationales.31638: Bronchoscopy with revision of tracheal/bronchial stent. Migrated SEMS repositioned from distal trachea back into left mainstem bronchus.

note_text:
Procedure: Stent Revision
Steps:
1. Rigid scope inserted.
2. Saw stent sticking out of LMS.
3. Cleaned up tissue.
4. Grabbed stent and pushed it back in.
5. Checked with flex scope, looks open.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Migrated LMS stent causing airway obstruction - stent revision

code_rationales.31638: Bronchoscopy with revision of tracheal/bronchial stent. Migrated SEMS repositioned from distal trachea back into left mainstem bronchus.

note_text: frank anderson has a stent in the left lung that moved up. went in with the rigid scope. saw it blocking the trachea a bit. grabbed it with the big forceps and shoved it back down where it belongs. looks good now breathing better.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Migrated LMS stent causing airway obstruction - stent revision

code_rationales.31638: Bronchoscopy with revision of tracheal/bronchial stent. Migrated SEMS repositioned from distal trachea back into left mainstem bronchus.

note_text: Rigid bronchoscopy performed for migrated left mainstem stent. Stent found extending into trachea. Granulation tissue removed. Stent grasped and repositioned distally into proper position within the left mainstem. Airway patent.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Migrated LMS stent causing airway obstruction - stent revision

code_rationales.31638: Bronchoscopy with revision of tracheal/bronchial stent. Migrated SEMS repositioned from distal trachea back into left mainstem bronchus.

note_text:
[Indication]
Migrated LMS Stent, obstruction.
[Anesthesia]
General/Jet Ventilation.
[Description]
Stent protruding into trachea. Repositioned into LMS using rigid forceps. Granulation tissue treated.
[Plan]
PACU then home.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Migrated LMS stent causing airway obstruction - stent revision

code_rationales.31638: Bronchoscopy with revision of tracheal/bronchial stent. Migrated SEMS repositioned from distal trachea back into left mainstem bronchus.

note_text: Mr. Anderson's airway stent had slipped out of place and was blocking his windpipe. We put him to sleep and used a metal tube to reach the stent. We carefully grabbed it and moved it back down into the left lung's airway where it is supposed to be. His breathing passage is now wide open again.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Migrated LMS stent causing airway obstruction - stent revision

code_rationales.31638: Bronchoscopy with revision of tracheal/bronchial stent. Migrated SEMS repositioned from distal trachea back into left mainstem bronchus.

note_text:
Procedure: Readjustment of endobronchial prosthesis.
Issue: Proximal migration.
Action: The prosthesis was manipulated and reseated within the left mainstem bronchus. Patency was re-established.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Migrated LMS stent causing airway obstruction - stent revision

code_rationales.31638: Bronchoscopy with revision of tracheal/bronchial stent. Migrated SEMS repositioned from distal trachea back into left mainstem bronchus.
